title: A Humble Trust
shortSummary: Psalm 131 is a brief yet profound expression of humility and childlike trust in the Lord by David. It emphasizes the importance of a quieted soul that does not pridefully pursue lofty ambitions but rests confidently in God's care. This psalm encourages believers to place their hope fully in the Lord with simplicity and faith.
timeline: c. 1000 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The author of this psalm, King David expresses his personal humility and trust in God, serving as a model for believers.

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: The nation of Israel is called to place their hope in the Lord continually, representing God's covenant people.

definitions.definition: Having or showing an attitude of superiority and contempt; prideful.
Accustomed to no longer relying on the mother's milk; symbolizing maturity and contentment without anxiety.
A type of psalm sung by pilgrims ascending to Jerusalem, often reflecting spiritual ascent and dependence on God.

outline.heading: David’s Declaration of Humility
outline.description: David opens by affirming that his heart is not proud nor his eyes arrogant, rejecting involvement in matters beyond his understanding, highlighting a spirit of humility before God.

outline.heading: The Quieted Soul Like a Weaned Child
outline.description: David compares his soul to a weaned child, illustrating a peaceful and contented trust in God, free from restless striving or anxiety.

outline.heading: A Call to Hope in the LORD
outline.description: The psalm concludes with an exhortation for Israel to place their hope in the Lord forever, encouraging steadfast faith and reliance on God.

application: Cultivate humility by rejecting pride and ambition beyond God’s will, trusting His sovereign plan.
Develop a peaceful, childlike trust in God that quiets anxiety and restless striving.
Encourage others to place their hope fully in the Lord, fostering a community grounded in faith.
Practice daily surrender to God’s guidance, resting in His care rather than self-effort.

keyVerses.text: LORD, my heart is not haughty, nor mine eyes lofty: neither do I exercise myself in great matters, or in things too high for me.
keyVerses.significance: This verse captures the essence of humility and self-restraint before God, setting the tone for the entire psalm.

keyVerses.text: Surely I have behaved and quieted myself, as a child that is weaned of his mother: my soul is even as a weaned child.
keyVerses.significance: It illustrates the peaceful trust and contentment believers should have in God, like a child who is no longer anxious or dependent in fear.

keyVerses.text: Let Israel hope in the LORD from henceforth and for ever.
keyVerses.significance: This final exhortation calls all believers to unwavering hope and confidence in God’s eternal faithfulness.
